info.description: QuePasa is a Go-based WhatsApp bot platform that exposes HTTP APIs for WhatsApp messaging integration
info.title: QuePasa WhatsApp API

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

post.description: Create, update, or manage user accounts (master access required)

get.description: Retrieves messages from WhatsApp server with pagination, timestamp and exceptions filtering (authenticated SPA endpoint)

parameters.description: Filter by exceptions: 'true' for messages with errors, 'false' for messages without errors, omit for all
parameters.name: exceptions

post.description: Archives or unarchives a WhatsApp chat. Archiving also unpins the chat automatically.
Marks a WhatsApp chat as read (removes unread badge)
Marks a WhatsApp chat as unread (shows unread badge)
Controls typing indicators and chat presence in WhatsApp conversations
Execute control commands for the bot server (start, stop, restart) or toggle settings (groups, broadcasts, readreceipts, readupdate, calls, debug)
Search WhatsApp contacts by name, phone, and other filters

get.description: Retrieves a list of all WhatsApp contacts
Downloads media files (images, videos, documents) from WhatsApp messages

put.description: Edits the content of an existing message by its ID

get.description: Get all environment variables and configurations (master key required for full access, preview available without auth)

post.description: Creates a new WhatsApp group with specified title and participants

put.description: Updates the topic/description of a specific WhatsApp group

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific WhatsApp group
Retrieves a list of all WhatsApp groups that the bot is currently a member of

post.description: Leave a specific WhatsApp group

put.description: Updates the name of a specific WhatsApp group
Add, remove, promote, or demote participants in a WhatsApp group
Updates or removes the photo of a specific WhatsApp group

get.description: Get, approve, or reject join requests for WhatsApp groups

post.description: Get, approve, or reject join requests for WhatsApp groups

get.description: Provides basic health check without auth, detailed server info with token/master key, or user's servers with username/password

post.description: Create a new bot/server with configuration before QR code scanning

get.description: Generates an invite link for a specific WhatsApp group
Generates an invite link for a specific WhatsApp group

post.description: Checks if provided phone numbers are registered on WhatsApp

get.description: Retrieves a specific message by its ID

delete.description: Revokes or deletes a specific message by its ID

get.description: Generates a pairing code for WhatsApp authentication using phone number

parameters.description: Days of message history to sync
parameters.name: historysyncdays

get.description: Create, get, or delete RabbitMQ configurations for message queueing

post.description: Create, get, or delete RabbitMQ configurations for message queueing

delete.description: Create, get, or delete RabbitMQ configurations for message queueing

post.description: Marks one or more messages as read by id. Accepts a JSON array in the request body (e.g. ["id1","id2"] or [{"id":"id1"},{"id":"id2"}])

parameters.description: Array of message ids or objects with id field
parameters.name: request

get.description: Retrieves pending messages from WhatsApp with optional cache filters

parameters.description: Filter by exceptions error status: 'true' for messages with exceptions errors, 'false' for messages without exceptions errors, omit for all messages
parameters.name: exceptions

parameters.description: Filter by message type (supports comma-separated list)
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Filter by category: sent, received, sync, unhandled, events
parameters.name: category

parameters.description: Search text in id, chat, text, trackid, participant and exceptions
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Filter by fromme boolean: true or false
parameters.name: fromme

parameters.description: Filter by fromhistory boolean: true or false
parameters.name: fromhistory

post.description: Forces re-dispatch of a cached message to webhooks/RabbitMQ using the message ID. Applies all original dispatching validations including TrackId, ForwardInternal, message type filters (groups, broadcasts, calls, read receipts).

get.description: Generates a QR code for WhatsApp Web authentication scanning

post.description:
Endpoint to send messages via WhatsApp. Accepts sending of:
- Plain text (field "text")
- Files by URL (field "url")  server will download and send as attachment
- Base64 content (field "content")  use format data:<mime>;base64,<data>
- Polls (field "poll")  send the poll JSON in the "poll" field
- Location (field "location")  send location with latitude/longitude in the "location" object
- Contact (field "contact")  send contact with phone/name in the "contact" object

Main fields:
- chatId: chat identifier (can be WID, LID or number with suffix @s.whatsapp.net)
- text: message text
- url: public URL to download a file
- content: embedded base64 content (e.g.: data:image/png;base64,...)
- fileName: file name (optional, used when name cannot be inferred)
- poll: JSON object with the poll (question, options, selections)
- location: JSON object with location data (latitude, longitude, name, address, url)
- contact: JSON object with contact data (phone, name, vcard)

Location object fields:
- latitude (float64, required): Location latitude in degrees (e.g.: -23.550520)
- longitude (float64, required): Location longitude in degrees (e.g.: -46.633308)
- name (string, optional): Location name/description
- address (string, optional): Location full address
- url (string, optional): URL with link to the map

Contact object fields:
- phone (string, required): Contact phone number
- name (string, required): Contact display name
- vcard (string, optional): Full vCard string (auto-generated if not provided)

Examples:
Text:
```json
{
"chatId": "5511999999999@s.whatsapp.net",
"text": "Hello, world!"
}
```
Poll:
```json
{
"chatId": "5511999999999@s.whatsapp.net",
"poll": {
"question": "Which languages do you know?",
"options": ["JavaScript","Python","Go","Java","C#","Ruby"],
"selections": 3
}
}
```
Location:
```json
{
"chatId": "5511999999999@s.whatsapp.net",
"location": {
"latitude": -23.550520,
"longitude": -46.633308,
"name": "Avenida Paulista, So Paulo"
}
}
```
Contact:
```json
{
"chatId": "5511999999999@s.whatsapp.net",
"contact": {
"phone": "5511999999999",
"name": "John Doe"
}
}
```
Base64:
```json
{
"chatId": "5511999999999@s.whatsapp.net",
"content": "data:image/png;base64,...."
}
```
File by URL:
```json
{
"chatId": "5511999999999@s.whatsapp.net",
"url": "https://example.com/path/to/file.jpg"
}
```
post.summary: Send any type of message (text, file, poll, base64 content, location, contact)

parameters.description: Request body. Use 'content' for base64, 'url' for remote files, 'poll' for poll JSON, 'location' for location object, or 'contact' for contact object.
parameters.name: request

post.description:
Endpoint to send documents via WhatsApp, forcing document type recognition regardless of file mimetype. Useful for sending images, audio files, or other content as documents.
Accepts the same parameters as /send but always treats attachments as documents.

Main fields:
- chatId: chat identifier (can be WID, LID or number with suffix @s.whatsapp.net)
- text: message text (optional)
- url: public URL to download a file
- content: embedded base64 content (e.g.: data:image/png;base64,...)
- fileName: file name (optional, used when name cannot be inferred)

Example:
```json
{
"chatId": "5511999999999@s.whatsapp.net",
"url": "https://example.com/document.pdf",
"text": "Please check this document"
}
```
post.summary: Send document with forced document type

post.description: Stops the WhatsApp server instance identified by {token}. Sends feedback to the caller on success.
Starts the WhatsApp server instance identified by {token}. Sends a system message to notify connected listeners.

Given a ProtocolMessage history-sync event message id, attempts to download and decrypt the referenced media using the active Whatsmeow connection, attaches it to the message and triggers an update so the UI and dispatchers are notified.
Send messages using any available server (spam/broadcast functionality)

Checksum for the message, used to verify integrity
and avoid duplicates

lid.description: (Local Identifier) new whatsapp unique contact id

chat.description: Em qual chat (grupo ou direct) essa msg foi postada, para onde devemos responder

forwardingscore.description: How many times this message was forwarded

Do i send that ?
From any connected device and api

inreaction.description:
Is this message a reaction to another message?
When true with empty Text, indicates a reaction removal

inreply.description: Msg in reply of another ? Message ID

participant.description: If this message was posted on a Group, Who posted it !

trackid.description: Optional id of the system that send that message

small image representing something in this message, MIME: image/jpeg
